intro: Pleurogyne carinata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed water plant, is a member of the Commelinaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and ponds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and clustered, with three petals and three sepals, and are usually greenish-white in color. Pleurogyne carinata is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
